intro: Boerhavia surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant features fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and gardens.
